div.ab: Ao DomAD 1809 bad repair. Hence nine hours in good weather to Tetuan – Aman of Xeriff who talked Spanish had an astonishing number of children –
El sobriñoThe nephew Abu Abdallah or Abu Abdihelsi was of same name as his Uncle. Therefore the Uncle was called El Zagal or Valiant & the Nephew El Zogoybi or unfortunate

A Spanish romance begins thus “En tiempo que el Rey Theseo “Residia en Badajoz Y quando Maricastaña Allà en Castilla reynò. Quando hablavan las bestiasiii. &c &c. In the time when King Theseus resided in Badajoz and when Maricastaña reigned there in Castile. When beasts spoke [hablaban]. &c &c. ['In the times of Maricastaña' being a Spanish phrase for long ago.] Spanish version appears exactly the same, other than punctuation, in Georges-Bernard Depping, Sammlung der besten alten Spanischen Historischen, Ritter- und Maurischen Romanzen (Altenburg and Leipzig, 1817), p. 437: 'Jupiters und Danae's Liebschaft'. This may be a coincidence, but WG certainly read German.
Against the inner arch of this gate the Moor broke his lance on going out with the King. A fatal omen.. At the last siege Muza walled up this & other Gates. The ballad says the Gates were of Brass
